column4: hi everyone. recently removed my windows 7 partition and am now running ubuntu 12.04 full time, unfortunately I now have a TON of unallocated space that I can't seem to use, tried running gparted from liveCD and disabled swap so I could expand my extended partition, which worked, but now I just have unallocated space (along with my 'normal' partitions) within my extended partition...a little help would be super.
usually it's very hard to work with the extended partition, so people work best only at 4 partitions max (especially true on msdos partition style table-- but this worry doesnt exist on GPT)
and i mean 4 "primary" partitions..
if you just installed it, and there's no data to backup on the drive, the best /easiest solution-- would be less time to wipe out the drive and start from scratch
I've used it for a while unfortunately and have quite a bit of stuff. I thought about doing that tho
well if there's alot of unallocated space, it's best to backup the data, and start from scratch :/ unfortunately..
i thought you were talking about unallocated space outside the extended partition
if its only unallocated data within extended.. you shuold be able to resize the logical partitions within

sorry, I didn't explain very well....I have a screenshot on ubuntuforums.org (and a thread there under general help) ...not sure if you have an account there but it might illustrate my problem a bit better
i dont think i need a screenshot.. you can do-> fdisk -l<enter>
err, the command works but....nothing happens.
maybe use it with sudo
where do I paste?
dunno.. check the topic :/
http://paste.ubuntu.com/1216073/
so use gparted live cd and grow /dev/sda5 .. if this is "/" then you'll need to rerun grub-install /dev/sda
sda5 is /boot
sda6 is / and sda7 is /home
and my unallocated space also doesn't show up anywhere in the paste, but I'm guessing that's normal? or not..
well can you move /boot with gparted ? it wouldnt even be a hundred meg
that's the problem, I can't 'move' or resize anything :\
gparted live cd.
http://gparted.sourceforge.net/livecd.php
that's what I've been using. doesn't work, can't move the sliders at all.
